column4: instruction
Wash hands and sanitize surfaces.
Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chicken breasts and cook until browned on both sides and cooked through.
Add cream of chicken soup and water, stir to combine, and bring to a boil.
Return chicken to the pan and simmer until internal temperature reaches 165°F, then serve.
Wash hands and sanitize surfaces.
Open cans of beans, corn, and crushed tomatoes and pour into a pot.
Add chili powder and stir to combine.
Heat mixture over medium heat until hot, stirring occasionally.
Serve hot. Refrigerate leftovers within two hours.
Wash hands and sanitize surfaces.
Drain pineapple and mandarin oranges and place in a bowl.
Add sliced banana, grapes, marshmallows, and coconut to the bowl.
Fold in low-fat vanilla yogurt until fruit is coated.
Cover and chill before serving.
Wash hands and sanitize surfaces.
Preheat oven to 325°F (163°C).
Beat egg whites until foamy; add cream of tartar and continue beating until soft peaks form.
Gradually beat in sugar until stiff peaks form; add vanilla and salt.
Gently fold in flour until just combined.
Pour batter into an ungreased angel food cake pan and bake for about 75 minutes.
Invert cake to cool before removing from pan and serving.
Wash hands and sanitize surfaces.
In a small bowl, whisk yogurt, mayonnaise, honey and paprika to make dressing.
Slice bananas and apples.
In a large bowl, combine salad greens, banana slices, apple slices and peanuts.
Pour dressing over salad and toss to coat.
Wash hands and sanitize surfaces.
Preheat oven to 350°F (177°C).
Beat butter and sugar together until light and fluffy.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Stir in flour, baking powder, and lemon rind until combined.
Spread batter into greased baking pan and arrange sliced apples on top.
Sprinkle with sugar and bake until a tester comes out clean, about 1 hour.
Brush warm cake with apricot jam and serve.
Wash hands and sanitize surfaces.
Preheat oven to 350°F (177°C).
Combine flour, salt, baking soda, cinnamon, brown sugar and oats in a bowl.
Cut in margarine or butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Press half of the crumb mixture into a greased baking dish.
Arrange sliced apples evenly over crust.
Sprinkle remaining crumb mixture over apples.
Bake for 40–45 minutes until golden brown and cut into bars once cool.
Wash hands and sanitize surfaces.
Shred cabbage, grate carrot, chop green pepper and apple, and combine in a bowl.
In a separate bowl, mix yogurt, mayonnaise, lemon juice, and dill weed.
Pour dressing over vegetables and toss to combine.
Serve immediately or refrigerate.
Wash hands and sanitize surfaces.
Preheat oven to 400°F (204°C) and line muffin tin with paper cups.
In a bowl, mix milk and applesauce.
In another bowl, combine flour, oats, sugar, baking powder and cinnamon.
Add dry ingredients to wet ingredients and stir until just moistened.
Fold in chopped apple.
Fill each muffin cup 2/3 full and bake 15–20 minutes until golden.
Cool before serving.
Wash hands and sanitize surfaces.
In a bowl, mix light mayonnaise and orange juice.
Add diced apples, celery, raisins and nuts and toss to coat.
Serve chilled.
Wash hands and sanitize surfaces.
Core the apple and cut into rounds or thick slices.
Spread peanut butter on one apple slice and sprinkle with raisins.
Top with another apple slice to make a sandwich; repeat with remaining slices.
Wash hands and sanitize surfaces.
Cut acorn squashes in half and scoop out seeds.
Microwave squash halves until just tender.
Melt butter and stir in chopped apples, brown sugar and cinnamon.
Spoon apple mixture into squash halves and microwave until squash and apples are soft.
Serve warm.
Wash hands and sanitize surfaces.
Core and slice apples.
Combine apples and water in a saucepan and bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer until apples are tender.
Stir in sugar until dissolved, mash or puree to desired consistency, and serve warm or chilled.
Wash hands and sanitize surfaces.
Rub cumin evenly onto both sides of chicken breasts.
Cook chicken in a skillet over medium-high heat until cooked through and remove to a plate.
Add apricot spread, lemon juice and water to the skillet and stir to create sauce.
Return chicken to skillet and coat with sauce; serve hot.
Wash hands and sanitize surfaces.
Bring a pot of water to a boil and cook asparagus until tender-crisp; drain.
In a skillet, melt margarine or butter and add lemon peel and garlic; cook briefly.
Add cooked asparagus and toss to coat with gremolata sauce.
Drizzle with lemon juice and serve warm.
Wash hands and sanitize surfaces.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add onion, garlic and red bell pepper; sauté until softened.
Add zucchini, yellow squash, lima beans and corn; cook until vegetables are tender.
Stir in chopped sage and cook briefly; serve warm.
Wash hands and sanitize surfaces.
In a bowl, combine diced avocado, corn, grape tomatoes, cilantro and lime juice.
Season with salt and gently toss.
Chill before serving.
Wash hands and sanitize surfaces.
Peel bananas and cut in half lengthwise.
Place bananas in a baking dish and sprinkle with brown sugar.
Dot with margarine or butter and sprinkle with raisins and pecans.
Bake at 350°F (177°C) for about 30 minutes until bananas are soft and caramelized.
Wash hands and sanitize surfaces.
Preheat oven to 350°F (177°C).
Place chicken pieces in a baking dish and sprinkle with garlic powder, pepper and salt if using.
Bake for about 1 hour until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear.
Wash hands and sanitize surfaces.
Preheat oven to 400°F (204°C).
In a bowl, mix cornflake crumbs with paprika, Italian herbs, garlic powder and onion powder.
Coat chicken pieces with the seasoned crumbs and place on a greased baking sheet.
Bake for 15–20 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and coating is crispy.
